binding.name: scope
binding.literal: . . . filled with glass micro balloons mixed to a stiff consistancy with Paraloid B72 (ethyl methacrylate copolymer) in acetone, and applied with a spatula.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: 3M Magic Tape 810 (cellulose acetate carrier, acrylic adhesive)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Archival Aids DAO11 solution (methyl magnesium carbonate)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Aerolam F board (glass fibre,epoxy laminate on aluminiun honeycombe)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: The application of a layer of red middle coating lacquer (a blend of suki-naka urushi and red iron oxide pigment)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Alkaline Rochelle salts (sodium hydroxide, sodium potassium tartrate)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Alkaline sodium sulphite (sodium hydroxide, sodium sulphite)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Appretan MB extra (vinyl acetate copolymer dispersion)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Aquarell watercolours (made up of ochre and gum arabic)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Archival Aids framing tape (acid free paper carrier ,polyvinyl acetate)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Ariel automatic (anionic and non ionic synthetic surfactants,sodium tripolyphosphate)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Auro paint stripping paste (potash,beeswax,ammonia,linseed & turkey red oils,alcohol)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Autochrome metal polish (emulsified blend of abrasives,emulsifiers & mineral oil hydrocarbons)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: BJK dough (Butvar B98-polyvinyl butyral,acetone,IMS,amyl acetate,xylene,water,paper dust,kaolin)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cleaned with *IMS*, using cotton wool swabs on a satay stick. After cleaning surface wiped with Kleenex tissue to remove the remaining solvent.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cleaned with 50/50 distilled water and *IMS*, using cotton wool swabs on a satay stick. Followed by acetone swabbed over the surface to expel any remaining traces of water. After cleaning, surface wiped with Kleenex tissue to remove the remaining solvent.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cleaned with distilled water and a few drops of *SYNP*, using cotton wool swabs on a satay stick. After cleaning, surface rinsed with distilled water on cotton wool swabs or a Kleenex tissue. Surface wiped with a dry Kleenex tissue to remove any remaining distilled water.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Object covered with Kleenex tissues wetted by spraying with distilled water and a few drops of *SYNP*. The object is left for a while to let the dirt soften. Cleaned with distilled water and a few drops of *SYNP* using cotton wool swabs and a satay stick. After cleaning surface rinsed with distilled water on a cotton wool swab or Kleenex tissue. Surface wiped with a dry Kleenex tissue to remove any remaining distilled water.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cleaned using a solution of *Ariel* in distilled water, using cotton wool swabs on satay sticks. After cleaning the surface is rinsed with distilled water applied on cotton wool swabs or Kleenex tissue. Surface wiped wth a dry tissue to remove any remaining distilled water.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cleaned by rolling cotton wool swabs over the surface moistened with 70/30 *IMS* and distilled water. Water residue removed using either *IMS* or acetone on cotton wool swabs. Paper tissue was used to remove smears.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Surface cleaned with tap water applied on cotton wool swabs on a satay stick.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Surface cleaned with distilled water applied on cotton wool swabs on a satay stick.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Surface cleaned with a 2% solution of *SYNP* in tap water on cotton wool swabs on a satay stick. Residue removed with tap water on cotton wool swabs.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Surface cleaned with a solution of *ARIEL* and tap water applied on cotton wool swabs on a satay stick. Residue removed with tap water on cotton wool swabs.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Surface cleaned with *IMS* applied on cotton wool swabs on a satay stick.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Surface cleaned with acetone applied on cotton wool swabs on a satay stick.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cleaned by completely immersing in a solution of *ARIEL* and tap water and left to soak for .... days. Rinsed by soaking in tap water. Left to dry thoroughly.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cotton wool swabs soaked in *Ariel* solution in tap water applied to stained areas. Rinsed with tap water.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cotton wool swabs soaked in hydrogen peroxide 30% w/v applied to stained areas. Object rinsed thoroughly by soaking in tap water for ...... hours to remove excess hydrogen peroxide.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Softened adhesive removed mechanically with scalpel blade.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Break edges brushed with stencil brush and *IMS*/acetone to remove adhesive

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dry cleaned with a soft sable brush to remove surface dust.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dry cleaned with *DRAFT*rubbed over surface with soft brush or fingers and removed with vacuum cleaner.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dry cleaned with *GROOM* rolled over surface on a cocktail stick.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dry cleaned with *ROWPUT* rolled over surface.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cleaned manually using a scalpel blade.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dust removed with a vacuum cleaner.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cleaned by immersing in a solution of *SYNP* and tap water. Rinsed in tap water and left to dry thoroughly.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Surface dust removed with soft brush, avoiding pigmented areas. Mud deposit softened with cotton wool swabs on satay sticks dampened with 50:50 solution of *IMS* and distilled water. Softened deposit loosened with scalpel blade taking care not to disturb any pigments underneath, and removed with soft brush and puffer.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dry cleaned with Mars Plastic Staedtler eraser rubbed over surface and removed with puffer.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cracks consolidated using ...% *HMG* in acetone applied with a micropipette. Excess consolidant removed with acetone applied on a cotton wool swab on a satay stick.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cracks consolidated using ...% *PARB72* in acetone applied with a .... Excess consolidant removed with acetone applied on cotton wool swabs on a satay stick.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cracks consolidated with *HXTL* applied to surface of object with a paint brush and drawn in by capillary action. Excess adhesive removed with acetone applied on a cotton wool swab on a satay stick.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cracks consolidated with 3 parts *CGXW396* to 1 part *CGXW397* applied to the surface of the object with a paint brush and drawn in by capillary action. Excess adhesive removed with acetone applied on a cotton wool swab on a satay stick.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Consolidated small flakes using ...% *PARB72* in acetone applied with a micropipette.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Consolidated surface with ...% *MOWB30H* in acetone and *IMS* applied with a micropipette.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Consolidated surface with ...% *PARB72* in acetone/*IMS* applied with a micropipette.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Consolidated lifting area with very thin sheet of *PARB72* inserted into gap. Acetone applied to soften resin and slight pressure applied to obtain adhesion.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Object completely immersed in tap water. Wash water changed on a daily basis. Conductivity readings taken of both the tap water and the wash water. DATE WASH WATER TAP WATER measured in siemens 10-5/10-4

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Object completely immersed in distilled water. Wash water changed on a daily basis. Conductivity readings taken of both the tap water and the wash water. DATE WASH WATER TAP WATER measured in siemens 10-5/10-4

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dismantled in an atmosphere of *IMS* in a glass dessicator with tissue support.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dismantled in an atmosphere of acetone in a glass desiccator with tissue support.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dismantled in an atmosphere of dichloromethane in a glass desiccator with tissue support.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dismantled by completely immersing in tap water.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dismantled using tap water applied to cotton wool swabs laid along joins.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dismantled using acetone applied to cotton wool swabs laid along joins.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dismantled using *IMS* applied to cotton wool swabs laid along joins.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dismantled using steam cleaner with distilled water directed along joins.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dismantled with *NITW* applied with a paint brush along joins and covered with aluminium foil to decrease evaporation.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Loose areas of surface faced up using strips of Japanese tissue secured at either end with 20% *PARB72* in acetone.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Acetone applied with a brush to remove the *PARB72*. Japanese tissue then lifted from surface with tweezers and any remaining adhesive removed with acetone and a paint brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas, supported on one side with dental wax, filled with *SUPCAST* mixed with water. Cut back with scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *POLINT* mixed with water. Cut back with a scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *FEW*. Cut back with a scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *CGXW396* 100 parts to 32 parts *CGXW397* mixed with *ARSIL* and *WIND*. Cut back with scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *MARI*. Cut back with scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Small holes filled with *POLFS*. Sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *DAVI*. Cut back with scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Small holes filled with *CELSTP*. Sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive papers.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Surface fine filled with French chalk mixed with *RUSWT*. Sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *HXTL* 3:1 resin to hardener mixed with *ARSIL* and *WIND*. Cut back with a scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *HXTL* 3:1 resin to hardener with *CABO* and *WIND*. Cut back with a scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *CGXW396* 100 parts to 32 parts *CGXW397* mixed with *ARSIL* and *WIND*. Cut back with scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with Ciba Geigy XW396 (epoxy) 100 parts to 32 parts Ciba Geigy XW397 (epoxy) mixed with *CABO* and *WIND*. Cut back with a scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *HXTL* and *MICR*. Cut back with a scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *CGXW396* 100 parts to 32 parts *CGXW397* and *MICR*. Cut back with a scalpel blade.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *HXTL* and glass beads. Cut back with scalpel.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *CGXWW396* 100 parts to 32 parts *CGXW397* and glass beads. Cut back with scalpel blade.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Fill cut back with a scalpel blade.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Fills smoothed with various grades of abrasive papers.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *SUPCAST* mixed with water. A seperating layer of aluminium foil applied to break edges. Dental wax used as a support mould, held in position using masking tape. Gapfill removed from object when hard, smoothed using a scalpel blade and various grades of abrasive paper. Gapfill sealed with *RUSWT* applied with a brush. Small imperfections filled using *POLFS* and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper. Fill bonded into position with *HMG*. Surface painted with *RUSWT* and *IMS* and *WIND*/ and *GASIL* applied with a sable brush. Polished with micromesh abrasive paper and *PRELM* on tissue. paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Sealed broken edge with 20% *PARB72* in acetone applied with a brush. Missing areas filled with *SUPCAST* mixed with water. Dental wax used as a support mould held in position using masking tape. Fill smoothed with a scalpel blade and various grades of abrasive paper. Surface sealed with *RUSWT* applied with a brush. Small imperfections filled with *POLFS* and smoothed with various grades of abrasive paper. Surface painted with *RUSWT* and *IMS* and *WIND* /and *GASIL* applied with a sable brush. Polished with micromesh abrasive paper and *PRELM* applied on a tissue.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *HXTL* 3:1 resin to hardener mixed with *ARSIL* and *WIND*. Cut back with scalpel and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas filled with *PARB72* mixed with *MICR*.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas packed with a paste of *MICR* in *PARB72*. Pared with scalpel blade and sanded smooth with various grades of abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cleaned by dry brushing followed by polishing with a silk wrapped cotton wool pad moistened with white spirit or Petroleum Ether.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing areas modelled using *MILL* and smoothed using French Chalk. Once cured, surfaces modified using various grades of abrasive papers.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Missing area modelled slightly smaller than required with *MILL*. *HXTL* 3:1 resin to hardener mixed to a gel with *ARSIL* and *WIND* and applied to modelled area with cocktail stick.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Moulded a profile with *DENT* softened with heat from a hot air blower/hot water.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Two part mould made with *SlCST105*. Cast made in *SUPCAST* mixed with water.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Removed registration numbers from visible positions with *IMS* or acetone applied on cotton wool swabs. Replaced on base with Rotring pen (Indian ink) sealing the surface first with 20% *PARB72*in acetone.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Disguised registration numbers in visible positions using *CRYLA*, as mechanical removal with solvents proved impossible. Replaced on base with Rotring pen (Indian ink) sealing surface first with 20% *PARB72*in acetone.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Conte a Paris drawing pencils (composition unknown)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Conte a Paris pastel pencils (composition unknown)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Painted with *RUSWT* and *IMS* and *WIND*/and *GASIL* applied with a sable brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Painted with *RUSPL* and *RUSTH* and *WIND* applied with a sable brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Painted with *ROWCRY* diluted with water applied with a sable brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Painted with *RUSWT* thinned with *IMS* and *MAIM* applied with a sable brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Painted with *RUSPL* and *RUSTH* with *MAIM* applied with a sable brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Fills polished with *PRELM* on cotton wool swab or paper tissue.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Fills polished with *SOLV* on cotton wool swabs or paper tissue.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Polished with fine grades of Micromesh abrasive paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Poulticed with *LAPRD* mixed with distilled water. Covered with cling film to slow down evaporation.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Poulticed with *LAPRD* mixed with distilled water and *IMS* covered with cling film to slow down evaporation.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Poulticed with *LAPRD* mixed with tap water covered with cling film to slow down evaporation.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Poulticed with acid free blotting paper soaked in water, tamped onto the surface with a stencil brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Reconstructed using *HMG* . Joins supported with ......... during curing.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Reconstructed using *HXTL* mixed in the proportion of 3:1 resin to hardener. Joins supported with ........ during curing.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Reconstructed with *PARB72* 50% in acetone applied to the break edges with a brush. Joins supported with ....... during curing.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Reconstructed using CGWXW396 (epoxy) 100 parts to 32 parts CGWXW397 (epoxy). Joins supported with ....... during curing.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Reconstructed with *SUPPXY*. Joins supported with ......... during curing.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Reconstructed with *ARAL*. Joins supported with ... during curing.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Reconstructed with *ARALR. Joins supported with ... tape.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Reconstructed with *LOCENG* UV curing adhesive. Joins supported with ... tape.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Reconstructed dry, securing with ... tape. *HXTL* applied to joins, drawn in by cappillary action. Excess removed with acetone on a cotton wool swab on a satay stick and a scalpel blade.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Reconstructed dry securing with ... tape. *CGXW396* 100 parts to 32 parts *CGXW397* applied to joins drawn in by capillary action.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Plaster surface sealed with *RUSWT* and *IMS* applied by brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Plaster fills sealed with *PARB72* in 50/50 Acetone /*IMS* applied by brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Edges of areas to be filled sealed with 20% *PARB72* in acetone applied by brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Steam cleaned using distilled water; run off dirt and water absorbed into soft tissue paper.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: *Mill* pellets pressed to back of uneven tiles to create an even top surface before sticking the tiles to the metal backing plate.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Tiles adhered to the roughened surface of an aluminium backing plate with *AR2005* mixed with *CABO*. Any excess around the edge of the tiles wiped off with tissue and acetone.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Back and sides of tiles sealed with 20% *PARB72* in acetone applied with a paint brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: The tiles were removed from the frame and the brass surround. Steam cleaned using distilled water; run of dirt and water absorbed into soft tissue paper. The brass surround and the frame were then replaced. After inspection by the MLA department the tiles again removed from the frame, the brass strips surrounding the tiles were secured with *SUPPXY*. Three of the brass tacks had broken heads,the heads were secured to their pins with *MILL*, which when cured was secured with *SUPPXY*. The glass frame was cleaned with a 2% solution of *SYNP* and water. It was then replaced.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Faced cotton-wool removed from box. Box dusted then lined with 5mm polyethelene foam padding cut to size, Foam dividers added if required. Any fragments of clay or ceramic unable to be aligned placed in a self-sealing bag, labelled and returned to box.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Lightly cleaned the surface with a soft sable brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dirt lodged in inscription removed using one or more of the following: cocktail stick, scalpel blade, fine pin, soft sable brush, puffer.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Friable areas consolidated using a solution of 10% *ParB72* in 50/50 Acetone/IMS applied using a micro-pipette.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Large cracks consolidated with *HMG* diluted with acetone applied by brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Low fired fragment edges consolidated using 10% *PARB72* in 50:50 *IMS* and acetone applied by brush before being aligned and joined using *HMG*.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Large open cracks or loose flakes consolidated with 10% *PARB72* in 50:50 *IMS* and acetone applied by micropipette.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Four trays were damaged by water leaking from the roof into 2 cupboards in ANE. Date unknown 2001? C.Walker. Some of the tablets where effected by this action, visible salts on surface of some tablets, resulting in unstable and flaking surfaces. 117438 to 117706 Conservation Research will assess the remaining water content.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: To support the fragments a detachable fill was necessary. The tablet surfaces around the lacuna were protected with *WTMSF* and one side was sealed with *PLAS* to form an enclosure. SUPCAST* was poured into the area and allowed to rest for approximately an hour. Resulting cast removed, sanded using wet and dry paper under runing tap water and allowed to dry. Plaster fill sealed using 10% *PARB72* in 50:50 *IMS* and acetone. Film removed and any specks of plaster removed with a sable brush. Sanded detachable fill colour matched using *CRYLA* diluted with tap water. Cast positioned and stuck to appropriate fragments using *HMG* and held with masking tape until cured.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: To support the fragments a detachable fill was necessary. The tablet surface around the lacuna were protected with *WTMSF* and one side was sealed with *PLAS* to form an enclosure. *SUPCAST* was poured into the area and allowed to rest for approximately an hour. Resulting cast removed, sanded using wet and dry paper. Plaster fill sealed using 10% *PARB72* in 50:50 *IMS* and acetone applied by brush. Film removed with a sable brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cuneiform object fired in Firing number 369 which contained 50 tablets. Object placed in 'saggar' and positioned on refractory shelf in an electric kiln. Position recorded. Firing programme '5' selected on the digital programmer. Firing began at 09.00 hours on 26th October 1998 soaking for 48 hours at 150 degrees then climbing to reach a maximum temperature of 740 degrees centigrade. Controlled cooling period. Kiln opened 2nd November 1998. Satisfactory result.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cuneiform object fired with batch number 362 which contained a total of 33 tablets. Object placed in saggar and positioned on refractory shelf in an electric kiln. Position noted. Firing programme '5' selected on the digital programmer. Firing began at 08.15 on 7th July 1997 first soaking for 48 hours at 150 degrees centigrade then climbing to reach a maximum temperature of 740 degrees centigrade. Controlled cooling period. Kiln opened on 14th July 1997. Significant debris and cracking but tablets were in very poor condition on receipt. Tablets in firing 362 were not desalinated.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cuneiform object fired with batch 371 which contained a total of 32 tablets. Object placed in saggar and positioned on refractory shelf in an electric kiln. Position noted. Firing programme '5' selected on the digital programmer. firing began at 09.00 on 11 August 1999 first soaking for 24 hours at 140 degrees centigrade then climbing to reach a maximum temperature of 630 degrees centigrade. Controlled cooling period. Kiln opened on 20 August 1999. Satisfactory result. Tablets in firing 370 were not desalinated. #CUNE.RENU#

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cuneiform object fired in Firing number 366 which contained a total of 41 tablets. Object placed in saggar and positioned on refractory shelf in an electric kiln. Position noted. Firing programme '5' selected on the digital programmer. Firing began at 14.30 on 27.4.98 first soaking for 48 hours at 150 degrees then climbing to reach a maximum temperature of 740 degrees centigrade. Controlled cooling period. Kiln opened on 5.5.98. Satisfactory results. Tablets in 366 were not desalinated. Tablet renumbering carried out by John Cooper using acryllic paint and sable brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cuneiform object fired in Firing number 370 which contained 32 tablets. Objects placed in saggar and positioned on refractory shelf in a electric kiln. Position recorded. Firing programme '5' selected on a digital programmer. Firing on the 9.00 on the 26th July 1999 soaking for 48 hours at 150 degrees then climbing to reach a maximum temperature of 740 degrees centigrade. Controlled cooling period. Kiln opened 12 August 1998. Satisfactory results. These tablets were not desalinated.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cuneiform object fired in Firing number 371 which contained 32 tablets. Objects placed in saggar and positioned on refactory shelf in a electric kiln. Position recorded . Firing programme '5' selected on a digital programmer. Firing began a 09.00 on the 11 August 1999 soaking for 24 hours at 140 degrees the climbing to reach a maximum temperature of 630 degrees centigrade. Controlled coolimng period . Kiln opened 20 August 1999. Satisfactory results. These tablets were not desalinateed.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cuneiform tablets fired in Firing number 372 which contained a total of 20 tablets. Objects placed in saggar and positioned on refractory shelf in a electric kiln. Position noted. Firing programme `1' selected on a digital programmer. Firing began 01.11.99 first soaking for 24 hours at 140 degrees then climbing to reach a maximum temperature of 630 degrees centigrade. Controlled cooling period. Kiln opened on 08.11.99. Satisfactory results. Tablets in 372 were not desalinated.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Cuneiform objects fired in Firing number 373 which contained 18 tablets. Objects placed in saggars and positioned on refractory shelf in a electric kiln. Postion noted. Firing programme `5' selected on digital programmer. Firing began at 9.30 on 10.11.99 first soaking for 48 hours at 150 degreess then climbing to reach a maximum temperature of 740 degrees centigrade. Controlled cooling period. Kiln opened on 20.11.99. Satisfactory results. Tablets in 373 were not desalinated.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Fragments aligned then joined using *HMG*. Fragments secured in position and placed upright in a sand tray until cured.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Fragments aligned then joined using *HMG*. Fragments secured in position (using masking tape strips) and placed upright in a sand tray until cured. (Masking tape strips removed using *IMS*).

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Examination, cleaning and consolidation carried out under binocular magnification X10.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Small support fill made from *MICR* in 30% *PARB72* in 50/50 Acetone/*IMS* and placed insitu upon prepared consolidated area. Left unpainted.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Gap fill painted using *liqacr* diluted with tap water applied by brush.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Renumbered the tablet using a black rotring ink pen on two coats of *PARB72* at 20% in 50/50 IMS/Acetone.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: The surface was dry cleaned using a fine scalpel blade, brush and vacuum.

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Degussa flattening agent OK412 (micronised amorphous silica)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Dow Corning silicone release agent (comp. unknown)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Duraglit metal polish (cotton wadding,white spirit,ammonium soap,china clay,Newburgh chalk)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Duraglit metal polish old formula (cotton wadding,white spirit,ammonium soap,siliceous earth)

binding.name: scope
binding.literal: Duraglit silver polish old formulation (cotton wadding,white spirit,siliceous earth)
